verses.text:
And David spake unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* the words of this song in the day \add that\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies , and out of the hand of Saul : \p
And he said , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* my rock , and my fortress , and my deliverer ;
The God of my rock ; in him will I trust : \add he is\add* my shield , and the horn of my salvation , my high tower , and my refuge , my saviour ; thou savest me from violence.
I will call on the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add who is\add* worthy to be praised : so shall I be saved from mine enemies.
When the waves of death compassed me, the floods of ungodly men made me afraid ;\f + \fr 22.5 \ft waves: or, pangs\f*\f + \fr 22.5 \ft ungodly…: Heb. Belial\f*
The sorrows of hell compassed me about ; the snares of death prevented me;\f + \fr 22.6 \ft sorrows: or, cords\f*
In my distress I called upon the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and cried to my God : and he did hear my voice out of his temple , and my cry \add did enter\add* into his ears.
Then the earth shook and trembled ; the foundations of heaven moved and shook , because he was wroth.
There went up a smoke out of his nostrils , and fire out of his mouth devoured : coals were kindled by it.\f + \fr 22.9 \ft out of his nostrils: Heb. by, etc\f*
He bowed the heavens also, and came down ; and darkness \add was\add* under his feet.
And he rode upon a cherub , and did fly : and he was seen upon the wings of the wind.
And he made darkness pavilions round about him, dark waters , \add and\add* thick clouds of the skies.\f + \fr 22.12 \ft dark…: Heb. binding of waters\f*
Through the brightness before him were coals of fire kindled.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thundered from heaven , and the most High uttered his voice.
And he sent out arrows , and scattered them; lightning , and discomfited them.
And the channels of the sea appeared , the foundations of the world were discovered , at the rebuking of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, at the blast of the breath of his nostrils.
He sent from above , he took me; he drew me out of many waters ;\f + \fr 22.17 \ft many: or, great\f*
He delivered me from my strong enemy , \add and\add* from them that hated me: for they were too strong for me.
They prevented me in the day of my calamity : but the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was my stay.
He brought me forth also into a large place : he delivered me, because he delighted in me.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* rewarded me according to my righteousness : according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.
For I have kept the ways of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
For all his judgments \add were\add* before me: and \add as for\add* his statutes , I did not depart from them.
I was also upright before him, and have kept myself from mine iniquity.\f + \fr 22.24 \ft before: Heb. to\f*
Therefore the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath recompensed me according to my righteousness ; according to my cleanness in his eye sight.\f + \fr 22.25 \ft in…: Heb. before his eyes\f*
With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful , \add and\add* with the upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright.
With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure ; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself unsavoury.\f + \fr 22.27 \ft shew thyself unsavoury: or, wrestle\f*
And the afflicted people thou wilt save : but thine eyes \add are\add* upon the haughty , \add that\add* thou mayest bring \add them\add* down.

For thou \add art\add* my lamp , O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* will lighten my darkness.  +  r 22.29  t lamp: or, candle *
For by thee I have run through a troop : by my God have I leaped over a wall.\f + \fr 22.30 \ft run: or, broken\f*

\add As for\add* God , his way \add is\add* perfect ; the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* tried : he \add is\add* a buckler to all them that trust in him.\f + \fr 22.31 \ft tried: or, refined\f*
For who \add is\add* God , save the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*? and who \add is\add* a rock , save our God ?
God \add is\add* my strength \add and\add* power : and he maketh my way perfect.\f + \fr 22.33 \ft maketh: Heb. riddeth, or, looseth\f*
He maketh my feet like hinds’ \add feet:\add* and setteth me upon my high places.\f + \fr 22.34 \ft maketh: Heb. equalleth\f*
He teacheth my hands to war ; so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.\f + \fr 22.35 \ft to war: Heb. for the war\f*
Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation : and thy gentleness hath made me great.\f + \fr 22.36 \ft made…: Heb. multiplied me\f*
Thou hast enlarged my steps under me; so that my feet did not slip.\f + \fr 22.37 \ft feet: Heb. ankles\f*
I have pursued mine enemies , and destroyed them; and turned not again until I had consumed them.
And I have consumed them, and wounded them, that they could not arise : yea, they are fallen under my feet.
For thou hast girded me with strength to battle : them that rose up against me hast thou subdued under me.\f + \fr 22.40 \ft subdued: Heb. caused to bow\f*
Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies , that I might destroy them that hate me.
They looked , but \add there was\add* none to save ; \add even\add* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, but he answered them not.
Then did I beat them as small as the dust of the earth , I did stamp them as the mire of the street , \add and\add* did spread them abroad.
Thou also hast delivered me from the strivings of my people , thou hast kept me \add to be\add* head of the heathen : a people \add which\add* I knew not shall serve me.

Strangers shall submit themselves unto me: as soon as they hear , they shall be obedient unto me.\f + \fr 22.45 \ft Strangers: Heb. Sons of the stranger\f*\f + \fr 22.45 \ft submit…: or, yield feigned obedience: Heb. lie\f*
Strangers shall fade away , and they shall be afraid out of their close places.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* liveth ; and blessed \add be\add* my rock ; and exalted be the God of the rock of my salvation.
It \add is\add* God that avengeth me, and that bringeth down the people under me,\f + \fr 22.48 \ft avengeth: Heb. giveth avengement for\f*
And that bringeth me forth from mine enemies : thou also hast lifted me up on high above them that rose up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.
Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, among the heathen , and I will sing praises unto thy name.
\add He is\add* the tower of salvation for his king : and sheweth mercy to his anointed , unto David , and to his seed for evermore.
